availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John E. Newman (Bardstown, Nelson County, attorney and judge)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Spencer County, Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Newman and Susan Newman. Married to Marion Olin Newman in 1847. Father of S. Newman, Thomas Newman, Richard Newman, William Newman, and M. Newman. Studied law under Martin McHenry in Taylorsville, Kentucky. Began legal practice in Spencer County in 1842. Attorney in Nelson County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860. Judge of Nelson Circuit Court in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 386A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 175.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p.14.
Find A Grave, "Judge John E. Newman (1819-1873)," Memorial 133570536, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133570536/john-e-newman (accessed April 14, 2020).
H. Levin, _The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 770-71.
